meanings.definition: Unable to be upset or excited; calm and composed.
meanings.sent1: She remained imperturbable even in the face of chaos.
meanings.sent2: His imperturbable demeanor helped diffuse the tense situation.
meanings.sent3: The imperturbable cat lazily watched the commotion around it.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an imperturbable lake, reflecting only tranquility.
meanings.sent5: The mountain stood imperturbable, unmoved by the passing storms.

meanings.definition: Not easily perturbed or agitated; steady and unflappable.
meanings.sent1: The imperturbable teacher handled the rowdy class with ease.
meanings.sent2: His imperturbable nature made him a reliable leader in times of crisis.
meanings.sent3: The imperturbable robot continued its task despite the chaos around it.
meanings.sent4: Her imperturbable resolve was like a rock in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The imperturbable old tree swayed gently in the breeze, unmoved by the storm.
